title.text: Discovering Phonotactic Finite-State Automata by Genetic Search

abstractContent.text: This paper presents a genetic algorithm based approach to the automatic discovery of finite-state automata (FSAs) from positive data.
FSAs are commonly used in computational phonology, but-given the limited learnabil-ity of FSAs from arbitrary language subsets-are usually constructed manually.
The approach presented here offers a practical automatic method that helps reduce the cost of manual FSA construction.
